description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the remote code execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-30013 in Windows Multipoint Services:

1. Identify the installed Windows version and build number on your system.
2. Download the appropriate KB update corresponding to your build from the Microsoft Update Catalog:
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5040442](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040442)
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5040442](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040442)
   - Windows 11 Version 21H2: [KB5040431](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040431)
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2: [KB5040427](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040427)
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2: [KB5040427](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040427)
3. Install the downloaded update package and restart your system to apply the changes.

**Details**:
This update addresses the double free vulnerability (CWE-415) that could lead to remote code execution, enhancing the security of your system against external exploits. Ensure administrative privileges are available to perform the update.

**Preconditions**:
- Verify that your system matches one of the specified build numbers before applying the update.
- Backup critical data before proceeding to install any updates to prevent data loss in case of issues during installation.
